definition: to adopt/to pass/to vote approval (of a law etc)
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
proportion needed to approve a decision
affirmative vote
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
one sentence/brief remark
of great concern
victory or defeat/result
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
to live or die/to exist or perish
not necessarily/may not turn out to be/maybe not
to foresee/to predict
to take sides with/to be partial to/to be biased/to favor one side
(literary) moreover/in addition
to offer an opinion/to comment (on the issue)/to have a say (in the matter)
that being the case/then/in that case
succeed or fail, sharp or blunt (idiom); advantages and disadvantages/success and failure/You win some, you lose some.
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
to pardon (a convict)
